channel.title: Java - Clearing a text file
channel.description:
Is there a simple way to clear out a text file? All that's in the file is a series of numbers, one to a line, etc:
[code] 176429 374730 927423 284474 483822[/code]

item.title: Java - Clearing a text file
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:9, topic:523105”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=641657.msg4322361#msg4322361 date=1372371512]

No problem, give it a try first, though.

I didn’t even end up using a file, lol.
[/quote]

What do you mean?[/quote]
There are other ways of data storage than flat files and some better alternatives so he learned how to use that probably.

Read full topic

item.title: Java - Clearing a text file
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:5, topic:523105”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=641657.msg4322309#msg4322309 date=1372367482]

PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(file); writer.print(""); writer.close();

Wouldn’t that just leave me with a bunch of blank lines? I need to use the file over and over again, repeatedly.
[/quote]

No that should clear the file (replace the contents with an empty string).[/quote]

Okay, thank you!

Read full topic

item.title: Java - Clearing a text file
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile

PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(file); writer.print(""); writer.close();
[/quote]

Wouldn’t that just leave me with a bunch of blank lines? I need to use the file over and over again, repeatedly.[/quote]

No that should clear the file (replace the contents with an empty string).
